title: Strictly Come Dancing star mocks Zoe Ball's weight and viewers are shook
text:
To view this video please enable JavaScript, and consider upgrading to a web browser that supports HTML5 video

Viewers of Strictly Come Dancing: It Takes Two could hardly catch their breath last night when Zoe Ball’s former dance partner made a joke about her weight – No. He. Didn’t.

Ian Waite, 48, who quit the BBC dance competition in 2009, was paired with Zoe in 2005 when they made the final of the series.

And on last night’s show it all started when Zoe suggested that Ian looked ‘ a bit like Johnny from Dirty Dancing’.

Advertisement

She said: ‘It’s a strong look. He’s going to lift me up in a minute. It’s going to be amazing.’

To which the 48-year-old replied bluntly: ‘I’m not that strong.’

The dancer’s comment quickly drew a reaction from the camera crews as they gasped.

Ian felt a little sheepish after he made the comment

(Picture: BBC)

Viewers of the show also took to Twitter to vent their anger.

One tweeted: ‘ Somewhere, Ian’s furious partner is cancelling their romantic dinner tonight #ittakestwo‘

Another commented: ‘SIT DOWN IAN’

One added: ‘I can’t believe Ian just said that.’

Although the TV host took the comment on the chin as she replied: ‘He’s got a point, I am 12 stone. I’m OK with that.’

Looking guilty, Ian added quietly: ‘I’m so sorry.’

Zoe didn’t seem to mind, telling viewers: ‘We have tried.’

Luckily for Ian, Zoe took the comment on the chin.

(Picture: BBC)

Ian was on the show to give his expert view on the celebrity dancers in It Takes Two’s semi-regular feature Waite’s Warm Up.

However, after making that kind of joke about the host – he might not be invited back on the show.

Zoe and Ian came third on Strictly Come Dancing in the 2005 series, scoring an impressive 38 out of 40 points in two different dances.

In 2011, she took over from Claudia Winkleman as the host of spin-off show It Takes Two.

Strictly: It Takes Two airs tonight at 6pm on BBC Two.
